The 2024 Wyoming Democratic presidential county caucuses were held on April 13, 2024, in the U.S. state of Wyoming, as one of the Democratic Party primaries ahead of the 2024 presidential election. 16 delegates to the Democratic National Convention will be allocated to presidential candidates. Joe Biden won the primary in a landslide, winning all 16 delegates.
Incumbent President Joe Biden announced his bid for a second term on April 25, 2023. He faced primary challenges from author, progressive activist, and 2020 presidential candidate Marianne Williamson, and Representative Dean Phillips.
President Biden won the caucuses in a landslide.
